what: Facet by regions or World Bank’s income groups
title: Features
text: plots facets can configure whether group data geographical regions income groups. Simply pass unquoted region income facets argument.
code: plot_dist_wdi("NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD", facets = income, p = 0) plot_dist_wdi("NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD", facets = region, p = 0)

title: Features
text: default, wdiquickplots shows data countries available. provides three ways subset countries include plot. three arguments : country let’s arbitrarily select countries (1…*). pass argument directly WDI, hence need use ISO-2 character code indicate countries (see ?WDI::WDI()). WDI, defaults “”. regions let’s select group countries, indicating World Bank regions. wdiquickplots:::regions income_groups let’s select group countries, indicating World Bank’s income classification. wdiquickplots:::income
code: plot_dist_wdi(   indicator = "NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD", facets = region, p = 0,    regions = c("Europe & Central Asia", "Latin America & Caribbean") )

what: Latest available data point per country
title: Features
text: plotting functions can specify period download data (start end year). However, plots show time series one point time per country. cases, default keep latest available data point country. try keep many countries possible data plot. , instead dropping countries missing data last year, rather keep tolerate somewhat older data. implication plot can contain non-comparable data, end-mixing different years different countries. course, can controversial certainly ideal. , say couple things: can always opt-default force wdiquickplots show year countries. , simply set start end value. Thus, ensure comparability. Just keep mind countries without data year simply dropped shown plot. Sometimes may ok. default behavior think sometimes ok. example, indicators change much time, may better older data points countries, drop altogether. way can least idea countries stand, even though data somewhat old. , sense defend behavior, … plots try transparent , . plots case try warn issue. many details can included plot , risk ending--cluttered plot. Thus, users plots also warn audience transparent .

title: Features
text: Main features described already site. plots allow customization. much really. example, bar plot allows user customize colors (see ?plot_bar_wdi) turn lollipop plot. addition, get plot objects prepared wdiquickplots (e.g. ggplot2 object) can go wild (e.g. override scale_fill_brewer change color palette, can even remove change facets). although can , certainly line spirit package. Quick plots!, fiddle long arguments trying change many things plot, quick plot anymore. also indicate need something different prefabricated plots package. cases, probably better using directly WDI get data make plot.

title: Features
text: Frequently missing values WDI data. NA years countries probably norm. make race plot unworkable countries (y-axis) go plot. race plot, key keep set categories constant time. mind, race plot keep countries least one non-missing value period time plot. keep countries years, just replace missing values interpolating valid values country. Animated bubble plots much noisy without interpolation. Missing values basically points go plot, movement animated creating just confusion. , also use interpolated data animated plots. cases, put plot indicators whenever interpolated point highlighted country shown. warning signs superscript numbers, ¹, ², ³, signal, respectively, x, y size indicators interpolated. Hopefully ’s transparent enough.

title: Features
text: Although always dealing rather small datasets package, every WDI call still API call download data. speed things little avoid downloading data (e.g. use data two different plots), memoise WDI calls. use memoise::cache_filesystem persistent across R sessions. Cache location ~/wdiquickplots_cache. memoise great job. famous quote goes, two hard things, cache invalidation naming things. , ever think caching WDI calls creating problems, just delete cache either running memoise::forget(wdiquickplots:::memoised_wdi) just finding cache file system deleting directory.

title: Quickplots examples
text: quick--create bubble plot. Basically function produce scatter plot pass codes indicators want x y axis, well indicator map size markers . Let’s see example showing public health expenditure vs. risk catastrophic health expenditure.

title: Quickplots examples
text: static version, powered ggplot2.
code: plot_bubble_gg_wdi(   x_indicator = "SH.XPD.GHED.GD.ZS",   y_indicator = "SH.SGR.CRSK.ZS",   size_indicator = "SP.POP.TOTL",   highlight_countries = c("India", "Germany", "Brazil") )

title: Quickplots examples
text: although can convert static bubble plot interactive one (e.g. using plotly::ggplotly), automatic conversions usually leave things better. Thus, also interactive version, powered plotly.
code: plot_bubble_ly_wdi(   x_indicator = "SH.XPD.GHED.GD.ZS",   y_indicator = "SH.SGR.CRSK.ZS",   size_indicator = "SP.POP.TOTL",   highlight_countries = c("India", "Germany", "Brazil") )

what: Quick Plots for WDI data and other World Bank-hosted databases
title: Quick Plots for WDI data and other World Bank-hosted databases
text: goal wdiquickplots provide, well, quick plots World Development Indicators (WDI, “primary World Bank collection development indicators, compiled officially recognized international sources.”). Just jump “Get started” page want take look quick plots examples. get WDI data, package powered WDI package, developed Vincent Arel-Bundock.s

title: Quick Plots for WDI data and other World Bank-hosted databases
text: can install Github repo :

title: Quick Plots for WDI data and other World Bank-hosted databases
text: Use case: hey present study working home country audience currently live (studying abroad whatever). Thus, background data home country order. table certainly , boring. let’s put plots .  go. ’s spirit package. One line code bang!, relatively decent plot can put slides convey quick message. Using package goes follows: Find code indicator interest. can use WDI::WDIsearch , actually find bit user-friendly simply go indicators page (https://data.worldbank.org/indicator) get code (’s URL). pass indicator code first argument different plotting functions package. second argument, pass countries want highlight. ’s . can read details description features pkgdown site little package (know, pkgdown site may overkill, anyway). can also see examples quick plots package, general, quickly show: highlighted countries stand terms indicator interest. compare among highlighted countries, rest world, regions income groups. changes time.

title: Download WDI data and prepare the dataset for the plots — download_wdi
code: download_wdi(   indicator = "NY.GDP.PCAP.KD",   highlight_countries = c(""),   start = lubridate::year(Sys.Date()) - 10,   end = lubridate::year(Sys.Date() - months(18)),   country = "all",   regions = default_regions(),   income_groups = default_income_groups(),   interpolate = FALSE )

title: Download WDI data and prepare the dataset for the plots — download_wdi
text: indicator character length 1 indicator code highlight_countries character vector country names highlight start first year download data end last year download data country subset countries download data . Default "". argument passed WDI::WDI hence, requires 'ISO-2 character codes, e.g. "BR", "US", "CA"'. regions character vector filter data specific regions income_groups character vector filter data specific income groups interpolate boolean indicate whether interpolate missing values

title: Download WDI data and prepare the dataset for the plots — download_wdi
text: data.frame columns country, year, ind_1, region, income,         highlight_ind_1. highlight_ind_1 = NA, except highlight         countries case, takes value ind_1

Modulus breaks factory — modulus_breaks
text: function tries replicate/approximate nice functionality log-transformation (`scales` package used `ggplot2` plots, using example ggplot2::scale_x_log10()). automatically shows breaks values original scale, even though axis transformed scale. Unfortunately, default behaviour transformations, modulus transformation particular.

title: Modulus breaks factory — modulus_breaks
Modulus breaks factory — modulus_breaks
text: p_custom p transformation exponent, scales::modulus_trans n.breaks_default number breaks

text: numeric vector breaks

title: Modulus breaks factory — modulus_breaks
text: function aim clever algorithm. Rather just calculates optimal breaks (labeling::extended) original transformed scales, combine , expressing original scale Take look scales::log_breaks ?scales::log_trans
